page.title: 04Beef Farming
page.content: In England Roast Beef is a favourite meal the farmer tries to provide our needs by Stock Rearing. On Mr. Takle's Farm at Treborough we saw some young calves being reared for their meat. It will be fattened up and sold as beef wehn it is between one and two years old. The catlle on Treborough Farm are all beef cattle but there are a variety of breeds for this purpose. Mr. Takle keeps a Charolais Bull but has got North Devon crossed with Hereford and also Hereford and Angus cows crossed with Fresian. On the highest land the grass is of too poor a quality to support anything other than sheep. Mr. Takle keeps a flock of Suffolk cross sheep.
